November 8, 1920
My dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
You remember the article you reviewed for
me on Yellow Fever, its distribution and control in
1920. The article was written after consultation
with General Gorgas, prior to his leaving for Europe.
You were kind enough to not only proof read it, but
to materially assist in the rearrangement in its
present form.

As the article was written purely with an
idea of furthering General Gorgas' plan of assembling
material for later use in historical form, the data
was largely such as you and he have talked and lived
in these twenty years that I have known you. For this
reason I felt that the article should be written in the
name of Gorgas-Carter-Lyster, and will appear in the
Dr. Henry R. Carter
-2-
November 8, 1920
Southern Medical Journal for December.

I trust that this meets with your full
approval, as I am sure that there is nothing in
the article of which I believe you would not
approve.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, T. E. Lyster Dr. Henry R. Carter,
c/o American Minister,
Lima, Peru.
